qas.question: When did the The Reformation in Europe start?
Who led the The Reformation in Europe?
What was the year of Martin Luther's death?
What parts of society did the Reformation change?
What was the previous language of the church?

context: The Reformation in Europe officially began in <a0_0>1517<a0_0/> with <a1_0>Martin Luther<a1_0/> (1483–<a2_0>1546<a2_0/>) and his 95 Theses. The Reformation greatly changed the Baltic region. Its ideas came quickly to the Livonian Confederation and by the 1520s were widespread. <a3_0>Language, education, religion and politics<a3_0/> were transformed. Church services were now conducted in the vernacular instead of in <a4_0>Latin<a4_0/>, previously used. During the Livonian War in 1561, northern Estonia submitted to Swedish control. In the 1560s two voivodeships of present-day southern Estonia, Dorpat Voivodeship (Tartu region) and Parnawa Voivodeship (Pärnu region), became the autonomous Duchy of Livonia within the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, under joint control of the Polish Crown and the Grand Duchy. In 1629, mainland Estonia came entirely under Swedish rule. Estonia was administratively divided between the provinces of Estonia in the north and Livonia in southern Estonia and northern Latvia. This division persisted until the early twentieth century.
